page.title: 10STUDLAND TRAFFIC PROBLEMS
page.content: Studland Beach and Sandbanks receive almost{1 million visitors}per year,most arriving by car.During 1984 cars were turned back from the area when parking became saturated.Roads here are generally narrow,winding and have many hills.Movement is made more difficult on minor roads because of slow-moving tractors,quarry trucks and caravans.The Sandbanks/Swanage road is the busiest.(Our survey noted 465 cars passing through Studland between 2-4pm on Sun.June 16th 1985.) Cycling is enjoying a revival and occasionally organised clubs may be seen on the roads as well as individuals and couples.
